tool.name: FPStep4
tool.description: Infer the presence and abundances of pathways based on gene family abundances in a sample.

param.name: input_file
param.label: FPStep3 prediction abundance file
param.help: Input TSV table of gene family abundances (either the unstratified or stratified output of FPStep3: FPStep3_pred_metagenome_unstrat.tsv

validator.message: A built-in database is not available

param.name: map_file
param.label: Pathway map file.
param.help: For 16S marker, chose Metacyc if the function selected in FPStep2 is 'EC'. Kegg if the function selected in FPStep2 is 'KO'. For ITS or 18S marker, Metacyc is the only databse available.

validator.message: A built-in database is not available

param.name: normalisation
param.label: Do you want to normalise the final output table ?
param.help: Values are divided by sum of columns , then multiplied by 10^6 (CPM values).

param.name: per_sequence_contrib
param.label: Do you want also a table stratified per sequences ?
param.help: Also product the predicted pathway abundance contributed by each individual sequence. This is in contrast to the default stratified output, which is the contribution to the community-wide pathway abundances. Note this will greatly increase the runtime.

param.name: per_sequence_abun
param.label: FPStep3 abundance per sequence file
param.help: Path to table of sequence abundances across samples normalized by marker copy number (FPStep3 output: FPStep3_seqtab_norm.tsv). This input is required when the --per_sequence_contrib option is set.

param.name: per_sequence_function
param.label: FPStep2 abundance function file
param.help: Path to table of function abundances per sequence, which was outputted at the FPStep2 (FPStep2_predicted_functions.tsv). This input is required when the --per_sequence_contrib option is set.

param.name: hierarchy_ranks
param.help: The ordered pathways ranks levels stored in BIOM. Each rank is separated by one space.

tool.help:
@HELP_LOGO@
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Prediction of functional abundances based solely on the sequences of marker genes with `PICRUSt2 <https://github.com/picrust/picrust2>`_.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Context
The fourth step of Picrust2 aggregates the gene families abundances into metabolic pathways abundances for each sample.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Input
**Gene families prediction abundance file**:
Input TSV table of gene families abundances. (FPStep3_pred_metagenome_unstrat.tsv)
**Map file**:
Mapping of pathways to reactions. For 16S analysis, please choose Kegg if 'KO' selected in FPStep2 or Metacyc if 'EC' selected in FPStep2. For other marker genes, only Metacyc available.
**Do you want to normalise the final output table ?**:
If this option is set, the pathway abundances file (FPStep4_path_abun_unstrat.tsv) is normalized: values are divided by sum of columns , then multiplied by 10^6 (CPM values).
.. image:: static/images/icon_warning_sml.gif
This normalization allows to compare the samples between them. But to perform more precise statistical analysis, some tools need the non-normalized abundance table to perform the normalization by themselves. So be careful which table to use for further analysis
.. class:: h3
Outputs
**Pathways abundances prediction per sample**:
Pathways abundances for each samples. (FPStep4_path_abun_unstrat.tsv)
If stratified option is activate, the abundances predictions are done for each OTU, in order to see the contribution of each OTU within each sample.
.. image:: static/images/icon_warning_sml.gif
Warning, the file produced may be heavy.
**Contrib per sequences file**:
If stratified option in actived, table output of contribution of each sequences within each pathway (FPStep4_path_abun_contrib.tsv).
**Summary file**:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep4_sunburst.png
Pathways (in KEGG and Metacyc) are classified according to 3 hierarchy levels, the graph shows the proportion of each level within the samples selected.
@HELP_CONTACT@
